oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Dr. Nathan B. Kennedy to Dr. Jabez P. Cannon
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Kennedy was surgeon of the 27th Ala. Inf., CSA, transferred to hospital service in Macon, Miss., then to Montgomery, Ala. and later took charge of the officers' hospital in Uniontown, Ala. His wife and baby traveled with him at times, and he once traded; whiskey for steamboat passage to escape Yankees. He also wrote of his life after the war. Sgt. J. P. Cannon, Co. C, 27th Ala. Inf., CSA. later became a druggist and wrote "Inside of Rebeldom: The Daily Life of a Private in the Confederate Army" in 1900.
